Posts.Content: SnowBird2 wrote: Hi, I'm new to the forum so please excuse me if I don't do this right.  I had a lumpectomy, chemo, radiation, and herceptin five years ago for a tumor in my left breast.  It was Herr 2 positive and hormone driven.  Now the nipple on my right breast has a rough, slightly raised, scaley, itchy lesion about the size of a dime.  I also want to say that I have psoriasis but I've never had it there and this isn't like my other psoriasis.  Is this something I should get checked out to make sure it isn't padgets disease?  I hate to make a big deal out of something thats probably nothing. Oh by the way I had a LCIS in my right breast fifteen years ago that they biopsied. Julie in Az for the winter Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm concerned SnowBird2 lemon68
